text: Night falls low, wind brushing past the lantern at the street corner.
Outside the tavern, hurried footprints mark the snow, stretching into the darkness.
Inside, only the fireplace flickers, firewood crackling softly.
The door is suddenly pushed open. Cold wind sweeps in, stirring the ashes. The flames tremble.
Lucia rushes in, breath uneven, snow still clinging to her face.
“Innkeeper—the mentor is in trouble!”
“Alicia is in trouble? Slow down—tell me clearly.”
I step out from behind the counter, my voice tightening unconsciously.
“She said she was going to treat the town guards’ wounds.”
Lucia bites her lip, her words trembling. “I was waiting outside… but not long after she went in, several men in black robes followed.”
“And then—she never came back out.”
I frown. “Black robes?”
“They all had the same mark on their chests.”
She traces a circular symbol in the air, her fingers shaking. “It’s the emblem of the ‘Echo Society’—weren’t they disbanded?!”
My heart sinks. I remember that name clearly—they were wanted by the kingdom years ago for ‘experiments using souls as material.’
I stop thinking and reach beneath the counter, grabbing the short sword.
“Let’s go.”
Lucia follows behind me, her voice trembling. “You… you know how to fight?”
I pause for a moment and take a deep breath.
“No.” I look at her, strangely calm. “But I owe Alicia once—and I don’t intend to owe her a second time.”
The street is shrouded in mist, snow crunching softly underfoot.
Wind carries ashes from the rooftops, the lantern light swaying precariously.
We follow Alicia’s footprints all the way to the scrap-iron alley in the northern district.
The houses there are half-collapsed, iron doors crooked, rust like dried blood.
I raise a hand, signaling Lucia to stop.
The snow-covered ground is eerily silent. From below, I hear a low murmur—someone is chanting.
Not prayer, but something colder, mechanical in rhythm.
Lucia holds her breath. “That’s… the rhythm of a ritual.”
She looks up, pale. “She’s still alive.”
“Then we save her.”
She nods, raising her staff and whispering an incantation.
Wind brushes past the latch, making a faint click.
We slip quietly down the dark staircase into the basement.
The air smells of iron and ash, cold blue light casting sharp shadows on the walls.
Several black-robed figures surround the ritual circle, chanting in overlapping waves.
At the center, Alicia is bound to a stone pillar, her charm glowing faintly.
“Mentor…”
Lucia calls softly.
She raises her staff, light gathering into a single point in her palm.
“Prepare to fight.” Her voice trembles, but she does not step back.

options.text: Option A: Charge forward and confront them head-on! 【Strength Check (STR DC 15)】
Option B: Distract them and give Lucia a chance to rescue her. 【Dexterity Check (DEX DC 12)】
Option C: Try talking to them—maybe you can stall for time. 【Charisma Check (CHA DC 13)】
